alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Middlesex; New Haven (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 28 at 7:26AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southern Connecticut, including the following counties, Fairfield, Middlesex and New Haven and southeast New York, including the following counties, Nassau and Suffolk. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 726 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Islip, Bridgeport, New Haven, Waterbury, Meriden, Brentwood, Milford, Middletown, Wallingford, Shelton, Commack, Riverhead, Huntington Station, Naugatuck, Centereach, Shirley, Deer Park, Lindenhurst, Medford and Guilford. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
